articles.content: In brief: Microsoft's Security Intelligence team is warning of a massive phishing campaign, apparently parading around with a Covid-19 theme -- which seems especially malicious given the current stat… [+2059 chars]

articles.author: Bogdan Popa
articles.title: Google Maps Quietly Updated with a New Feature Nobody's Going to Like - autoevolution
articles.description: Google Maps continues to be the mobile app and service that everyone loves and uses, but on the other hand, it doesn’t necessarily mean that all updates are well received by users out there.
articles.content: For example, while everybody seems to love the traffic flow information that has recently been added to Google Maps (and which is inspired from a similar feature available in the Google-owned Waze), … [+1359 chars]

articles.author: Ed Bott
articles.title: Project Reunion: Microsoft's unified app strategy is still missing one piece - ZDNet
articles.description: At last week's virtual Build 2020, Microsoft showed off its vision for Project Reunion, a new API that combines Win32 and the Universal Windows Platform. It's still missing the most important piece, however.
articles.content: Microsoft held its first Build Developers Conference in September 2011. At last week's virtual Build 2020 conference, nearly nine years later, the company was still trying to clean up the mess after … [+6362 chars]

articles.title: Microsoft Turns Bizarre To 11 With Fingerprint Scanning Headphones - Forbes
articles.description: Do you know what's missing from your headphones? Microsoft thinks it's a fingerprint scanner. No, seriously.
articles.content:
